Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Annotation Interface DeserializedJSONConstructor

@Documented @Retention(RUNTIME) @Target({CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD}) public @interface DeserializedJSONConstructor

This annotation marks a single constructor in a JSONSerializable class as the target for JSON deserialization. The deserializer will invoke the constructor that has this annotation to create the deserialized object. JSONDeserializer can pass parameters derived from JSON into the constructor, allowing for immutable type support. For example, a theoretical class called ObjectHolder could only have one final field, and it could be initialized through the constructor only.

If multiple constructors are marked with this annotation, a random one will be selected. Please make sure this does not happen as your program will have an unpredictable output.

This annotation may also be availible in the future for use with "constructor methods," which are static methods that return instances of the class. For now, these are still unsupported.

See Also:
DeserializedJSONTarget
